name: Doxepin (Sinequan)
summary: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used for depression, anxiety, and certain sleep disorders.
description: Doxepin is a tricyclic antidepressant that inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin, with strong antihistaminic and sedative properties. It is indicated for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, and insomnia at lower doses. At higher doses, it functions primarily as an antidepressant; at lower doses, it is used as a hypnotic due to potent histamine H1 receptor antagonism.

contraindications: Concurrent use of MAOIs or within 14 days
Hypersensitivity to doxepin or other TCAs

sections.text: Inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin; antagonizes histamine H1, alpha-adrenergic, and muscarinic receptors.

adult.depression_anxiety: Start 25–75 mg/day, titrate to 100–300 mg/day in divided doses or once nightly

sections.geriatric: Lower initial doses recommended; e.g., 10–25 mg/day for depression/anxiety
sections.renal_impairment: No specific adjustment, but use caution

items: Capsules: 10 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg

sections.text: Antidepressant effect: 2–4 weeks; sedative effect: within 30 minutes to 1 hour (low-dose use).

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Risk of anticholinergic side effects—use caution in elderly
Avoid abrupt discontinuation to reduce withdrawal symptoms

items: ECG in older adults or those with heart disease

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended for depression in children; insomnia indication only for adults
sections.geriatrics: More sensitive to sedative and anticholinergic effects

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over several weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, headache, and malaise.

items: Low-dose doxepin (3–6 mg) is FDA-approved for sleep maintenance insomnia
Sedative effects may be beneficial in depressed patients with significant insomnia
Has strong antihistamine activity—useful for pruritus
